title: Instructional Design Process for Improving Satisfaction in Online and Hybrid Mathematics Education

context.additional_context: Aims to effectively design online and hybrid mathematics education in simulation/VR environments, with an emphasis on activity design to enhance peer interaction

learning_goals: Learners can complete math problem-solving simulations in online/VR environments with over 80% accuracy.
Learners achieve a score of 3 or higher on a rubric by explaining math concepts through collaborative activities with peers in a hybrid class model.
Learners rate at least 4 out of 5 items (convenience, interaction, lecture quality, etc.) with a score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) in an online education satisfaction survey.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
